name: Date Nut Cake
description: This easy vegan date nut cake is moist, fluffy, and packed with chewy dates and crunchy pecans and walnuts! So simple to make and the perfect sweet treat to bring to a potluck or bake sale. Gluten-free option.Â
recipeIngredient: 1 cup non-dairy milk such as almond, (soy, coconut, or oat)
1 teaspoon white or apple cider vinegar
1/4 cup sugar (use 1 tablespoon more if you like your cake sweeter)
a few drops of almond extract (optional)
1 1/2 cup flour (I used all-purpose, you can also use a mix of all-purpose and whole wheat)
1/2 - 3/4 cup chopped nuts and seeds such as pecans
9  large dates chopped or use 12 small dates

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix all the wet ingredients. Mix until well combined and the sugar is well dissolved.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, mix all the wet ingredients. Mix until well combined and the sugar is well dissolved.

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl, add the flours, almond flour, nuts, baking powder, baking soda, salt and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl, add the flours, almond flour, nuts, baking powder, baking soda, salt and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add in the dates and mix in.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add in the dates and mix in.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the dry to the wet mixture and mix until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the dry to the wet mixture and mix until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: You should get a somewhat thick, muffin-like batter. If it is too thin, you can add in 1-3 tablespoons of more flour. If it is too thick, you can add in a few teaspoons of non-dairy milk and mix in.
recipeInstructions.name: You should get a somewhat thick, muffin-like batter. If it is too thin, you can add in 1-3 tablespoons of more flour. If it is too thick, you can add in a few teaspoons of non-dairy milk and mix in.

recipeInstructions.text: Line an 8 x 8-inch brownie pan or a 9 x 5-inch loaf pan with parchment. Transfer the batter to the pan. Even on the batter first with a spatula. Then top the batter with pecans and sugar.
recipeInstructions.name: Line an 8 x 8-inch brownie pan or a 9 x 5-inch loaf pan with parchment. Transfer the batter to the pan. Even on the batter first with a spatula. Then top the batter with pecans and sugar.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180c) for 30 minutes for the 8x8 inch brownie pan and 40 minutes or longer for a loaf fan.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180c) for 30 minutes for the 8x8 inch brownie pan and 40 minutes or longer for a loaf fan.

recipeInstructions.text: Check with a toothpick from the middle. It should come out clean. Else bake 5-10 mins longer.
recipeInstructions.name: Check with a toothpick from the middle. It should come out clean. Else bake 5-10 mins longer.

recipeInstructions.text: Cool in the pan for 10 minutes and remove from the pan. Let it cool for another 15-20 minutes before slicing.Store on the counter for the day and refrigerate in a closed container for upto 7 days
recipeInstructions.name: Cool in the pan for 10 minutes and remove from the pan. Let it cool for another 15-20 minutes before slicing.Store on the counter for the day and refrigerate in a closed container for upto 7 days

keywords: cake with dates, vegan date cake, vegan nut cake
